results.title: Glassmakers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
A survey of the wide range of glass products manufactured by British craftsmen. Includes manufacture of plate glass and installation of a large sheet in one of the Festival of Britain buildings; making of stained glass windows; manufacture of optical glass and lenses; prisms and lanterns for lighthouses; production of electric light globes; glass blowing and making of nahd0made cut glass.

results.title: Fremantle cray fishers
results.brief_description: The departure of the cray fishing boats from Fremantle, Western Australia, in the early morning to the fishing grounds in the deep water. These hard working fishermen work a twelve hour day and are dependent on the weather and the mood of the sea for a good season. After the long day they return to port with their catch.

results.title: Freedom river
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: A contemporary animated parable which examines the indifference that makes people blind to the injustices around them. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: Dream
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: A partly animated film based on a series of drypoint prints (‘Movements’ and ‘Combats’) by Australian printmaker Charles Lloyd on the theme of aggression in society. The sound composition by Arthur Cantrill is a mix of percussion and altered piano (plucking and hitting strings and soundboard, played by Arthur Cantrill), sound effects (including breathing), and electronically modified children’s laughter, recorded on a Nagra reel to reel tape recorder and transferred to 16mm magnetic tracks which were laid and mixed in a professional sound studio, where reverberation was added to some sections.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

A scenic film which shows the coastline of Victoria, and its wildlife. Without commentary.

results.title: Blue like an orange
results.brief_description: Puppets of the Orient and the Occident are presented in this UNESCO contribution to understanding between East and West. Scenes of puppet plays in India, Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, Laos, Poland, Czechoslovakia and the United States today. The presentations illustrate the great variety of the traditions which have survived for thousands of years. Also includes archival footage of Jim Henson and “the muppets” including a very early Kermit.

results.title: The Bedspread
results.creator_credit: Natalie Green, Elizabeth O'Neill and Berry St Film Productions
results.brief_description: Concerns two poverty-stricken women, Mrs Clancy and Mrs Parsons, living in Melbourne during the depression. Mrs Clancy owns a good bedspread, her pride and joy. Mrs Parsons asks to borrow the bedspread in preparation for a visit by a specialist to her sick daughter. This small incident becomes the focal point of the day. Cast includes Janet Robertson, Moira Claux and Kim Deacon. Based on a short story by Iris Simmons.

results.title: Beard and bass
results.brief_description: An experimental short film about a bearded young man and a double bass. Clasping the instrument he tries to cross a street. Suddenly his attention is arrested by a girl whose charms he appreciates. She smiles at him and crosses the street. He stares at her and then realising suddenly that she has disappeared, he props up his double bass against the tree and disappears into the crowd. Music by George Dreyfus, edited by Peter Tammer.

results.title: Be smart... don't start
results.brief_description: Especially designed for elementary grades at school, this film looks at cigarette smoking and the hazards of starting the habit. It presents opposing opinions and claims of cigarette manufacturers and medical men in an effort to create a lifetime mental attitude toward smoking at this critical age level.

results.title: The Unfinished Dance
results.creator_credit: Henry Koster, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Aspirational young ballet dancer refuses to let anything or anyone get in her way to becoming a prima ballerina. Cast includes Margaret O’Brien, Cyd Charisse, Karin Booth, Esther Dale, Thurston hall, harry hayden, Danny Thomas.
